isly ilwott

It appears that some backers of Barack Obama have hacked into personal email accounts of Sarah Palin and posted personal information on a web page. Should the perpetrators be prosecuted and punished in accordance with the law? ...or should we just accept this behavior as verification that all is fair in the run-up to an election?
 
 http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2008/09/17/palins-email-account-hack_n_127184.html
 
 The attacks on Palin are to be expected. I note that the article posted in the link is accompanied by ads for Barack's Miracle Book. There are hundred's of hits on 'palin email' with Google...just don't believe everything you read these days.
 
 It's nobody's business why Sarah Palin uses Yahoo. It's a communication tool, supposedly private, supposedly protected yet vunerable to abuse by unscrupulous, deceptive promoters of change at any cost. I'm quite sure that Obamessiah will deny any knowledge or approval of the action, and that he is secretly smirking about its result and not at all displeased with its occurence.
 
 What do you think? Should the hackers go to prison?
CUNxTime

Of course they should be punished to the full extent of the law. And the tactic itself is deplorable. However, after seeing all the mistreatment of conservative candidates (have you seen a side by side comparison of the Palin/Obama interviews?) as well as outright lies and the obvious partisanship of much of the media, we should probably expect this. More and more, it seems, the right is the only side left playing by the rules. Inner-city voting scandals that don't get any air time and etc. show that if the right is going to win, it must be able to do so IN SPITE of left wing bias, fraud, and dirty tricks!!!

I have no doubt that the hacker(s) who did this were members of the Democratic dirty tricks teams out their attempting to destroy Sarah with the politics of personal destruction. Much like the cabal of lawyers who the dems have sent up to Alaska to dig into every aspect of her personal and professional life looking for dirt on her. I just hope and pray that the FBI and the Secret Service who is investigating this crime, find the culprits and can prove a political connection that leads back to the source.

 I don't know if they are hackers so much as obnoxious kids who want to 'prove' themselves to people. I think two things
 
 1) Using Yahoo for official government business is stupid, irresponsible, and just plain dumb. I don't know if it is illegal or not, but it certainly isn't best
 practices.
 
 2) People who hack into anybodies account for what ever reason should be prosecuted. It's not rare, but the attention this is getting certainly is. I think they deserve to be shown up as a model of what should happen to anybody to hacks into people's private accounts. What they did was stupid, irresponsible and just plain done, and it IS illegal.

I don't know if they are hackers so much as obnoxious kids who want to 'prove' themselves to people. I think two things

 
 If they're just obnoxious kids who want to prove themselves to people, why didn't they sign their work so we all know who they are?
 
 
1) Using Yahoo for official government business is stupid, irresponsible, and just plain dumb. I don't know if it is illegal or not, but it certainly isn't best
 practices.

 
 This Yahoo account was her personal account, not her Government account. The question the pundits asked was, did she do official Government business on her private account.
 
 
2) People who hack into anybodies account for what ever reason should be prosecuted. It's not rare, but the attention this is getting certainly is. I think they deserve to be shown up as a model of what should happen to anybody to hacks into people's private accounts. What they did was stupid, irresponsible and just plain done, and it IS illegal.

 Doh , that should be obvious to the most dense and ignorant. It's illegal. I predict they will find them, I also predict they will be 22 or younger.
 
 

 This Yahoo account was her personal account, not her Government account. The question the pundits asked was, did she do official Government business on her private account.
 

 Which, of course, is a good question. That is stupid too. I don't know what if any 'official' business was done on her account. If she did any, it was stupid. 
 
 I am more concerned about the ethic lapses in her administration, her lack of knowledge about a lot of things a good VP should know, and her positions on just about everything.
